title: Renaissance: Humanism, Art, and Scientific Revolution

vocab.definition: Period of renewed interest in classical learning and arts (1300-1600)
Intellectual movement emphasizing human potential and achievement
Wealthy person who financially supports artists and scholars
Systematic approach to understanding natural world through observation
Machine that revolutionized book production and spread of ideas

teachingNotes: Emphasize the cultural shift from medieval to modern thinking. Discuss key figures like Leonardo da Vinci and their contributions.

sample.question: What period renewed interest in classical learning and arts?
What did the printing press do?

truefalse.question: Humanism emphasized human potential and achievement. (True or False)
The Renaissance occurred in 1300-1600. (True or False)
Patrons were poor supporters. (True or False)
The printing press revolutionized book production. (True or False)
The scientific method uses systematic observation. (True or False)
Humanism ignored human achievement. (True or False)
Patrons financially supported artists. (True or False)
The scientific method is unsystematic. (True or False)
The printing press spread ideas. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What is a wealthy supporter of arts?

fillintheblank.question: The _____ renewed interest in classical learning.
A _____ financially supports artists and scholars.
The _____ _____ is a systematic approach to understanding nature.
_____ were wealthy supporters of the arts.

shortanswer.question: What was the Renaissance?
expectedAny: Period of renewed interest in classical learning and arts from 1300-1600
Cultural rebirth focusing on classical knowledge
Era of artistic and intellectual revival

shortanswer.question: What is humanism?
expectedAny: Intellectual movement emphasizing human potential and achievement
Focus on human abilities and worth

shortanswer.question: What did patrons do?
expectedAny: Wealthy people who financially supported artists and scholars

shortanswer.question: What is the scientific method?
expectedAny: Systematic approach to understanding natural world through observation
Method of inquiry using observation and testing

shortanswer.question: What did the printing press do?
expectedAny: Revolutionized book production and spread of ideas

shortanswer.question: Why was the Renaissance important?
expectedAny: Cultural shift from medieval to modern thinking
Revived classical knowledge and sparked innovation

shortanswer.question: How did humanism change thinking?
expectedAny: Emphasized human potential and individual worth
Focused on human achievement rather than just divine

shortanswer.question: Why were patrons important?
expectedAny: Funded artists and scholars enabling Renaissance achievements
Made artistic and intellectual work possible

shortanswer.question: How does the scientific method work?
expectedAny: Uses systematic observation and testing based on evidence

shortanswer.question: What impact did printing have?
expectedAny: Spread knowledge and ideas widely and quickly
Made information accessible to more people
